title.narrative: Women as central agents for peacebuilding in Colombia

description.narrative: The overall objective of the program “Women as central agents for peacebuilding in Colombia” is to ensure the empowerment of women and women’s organizations to facilitate their active participation as agents of change in the construction and consolidation of peace in Colombia with a territorial focus. For more information, see description overall program [include reference] In the context of this program, Mensen met een Missie, together with 7 local partner organizations, will contribute to: the prevention of gender based violence (including women trafficking); the promotion of an enabling environment for gender equality; and the promotion of participation of women as agents of change and peace promotors in decision making processes and in peace building at the local level.
Contract between Mensen met een Missie and ICCO

title.narrative: Result 1.1.2 Strengthened capacities of 155 policy makers / government officials in # regions: Policy makers / government officials have increased information and knowledge on GBV and skills and capacities on how to attend and ensure safe conditions for victims of SGBV

description.narrative: 1.1.2 Strengthened capacities of 155 policy makers / government officials in # regions: Policy makers / government officials have increased information and knowledge on GBV and skills and capacities on how to attend and ensure safe conditions for victims of SGBV

title.narrative: # public functionaries with more interest and knowledge of GBV, and greater capacities to assist women victims

Result 2.1.2 # young men and women belonging to local groups and communities have been trained for the promotion of roles, attitudes and respectful, equal gender relationships, contributing to the protection of women’s' rights and the prevention of GBV.
# young women and men trained as agents of change for the promotion of gender equality

comment.narrative: 525 young women and men with increased knowledge and capacities to contribute to gender equality (in process; participated in first capacity building sessions)

title.narrative: Result 3.1.1. Women have enhanced their skills, capacities and knowledge to increase their role in decision making processes; and in peace building in their communities > Women become agents of change and peace promotors

# women have enhanced their skills, capacities and knowledge to increase their role in (a) decision making processes; (b) conflict prevention and resolution and peace building in their own communities

comment.narrative: 600 women leaders participated, 9 aliances linked to NAP 1325 program

title.narrative: Result 1.1.1 Strengthened organizational and individual capacities for the participation of # women leaders through training processes, multiplication and empowerment programs in # regions of Colombia.

# women have enhanced their skills, capacities and knowledge to participate in decision making scenarios and influence implementation of public policies (increased leadership, organizational and lobby capacities); to prevent gender based violence (incl. women trafficking) and assert their rights

Result 2.3.1 # Men have increased understanding of gender relations, deconstruction of masculine-patriarchal practices, new masculinities, and their role in the prevention of GBV and the promotion of gender equality, and begin playing a role as agents of change in their communities
# men have increased their understanding and role in prevention of GBV and promotion of gender equality

Result 1.3.1 Political advocacy for women and their organizations is strengthened through lobby and monitoring actions regarding the legislation and public policy at the national and local level with regards to the prevention of gender based violence (CONPES 161 (2013), Ley 1257 de 2008 on non-violence against women, UNSCR1325 and other related decrees), from spaces of alliance and coordination with women's organizations

# women actively participating in lobby and monitoring actions (monitoring and encouraging implementation of legislation and public policies); exchanging knowledge via participation in lobby and dialogue platforms or networks of women’s organizations

Result 1.2.1 An investigation line with participative methodologies will be implemented, generating relevant knowledge on the social, cultural and religious understandings related to gender equality and SGBV

Result 2.2.1 Local and regional processes of visibilization and social mobilization have contributed to the increased understanding and transformation of perceptions and practices that perpetuate the violence and exclusion of women.
# persons sensitized and informed through communication, information and awareness raising campaigns

Result 3.3.1 and further. A process of knowledge building is held with ICCO, HNTPO, MM and their partners in relation to women in training, lessons learned and challenges in the implementation of NAP Colombia UNSCR1325; and information is exchanged.
